intro: Hieracium badalii, commonly known as the Badalii hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium badalii is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
